title: Lil' Kim tangles with animal rights activist ahead of appearance in NYC: 'Back up! Back up!'
text:
Lil' Kim and an animal rights activist clashed on the streets of New York City on Tuesday as the rap artist was making her way into the Build Studio.

The protesters were there with the outspoken group PETA, according to The Blast.

One protester was particularly outspoken toward the 45-year-old artist, whose real name is Kimberly Denise Jones, yelling, 'Animals get electrocuted ... Lil' Kim, stop wearing fur! ... shame on you for wearing fur!

Tense: Lil' Kim, 45, and an animal rights activist clashed on the streets of New York City on Tuesday as the rap artist was making her way into the Build Studio

The Magic Stick singer didn't retreat, yelling at the woman - who toted a sign that read 'Lil Kim Animal Abuser ' - yelling back at her, 'Back up! Back up!'

Security guards on hand swamped the area to ensure the confrontation would not get physical amid the high tension.

Another protester yelled at the New York native, 'Have a heart, have some compassion,' in the sidewalk showdown.

The How Many Licks? rapper was later seen signing autographs for fans on the busy Big Apple sidewalk.

Conflict: The Lady Marmalade singer did not retreat after she was heckled by the protester

Under pressure: Another protester yelled at the New York native, 'Have a heart, have some compassion,' in the sidewalk showdown in the Big Apple

The Girls Cruise star is one in a number of stars who have been confronted for her fashion choices, along with Jennifer Lopez, Chrissy Teigen and Kim Kardashian, who was infamously flour bombed by a PETA member in March of 2012 during a promotional event in West Hollywood, California.

The incident led Kim's sister Khloe - who had past posed nude for an ad campaign in PETA's support - to breaking ties with the organization.

Khloe subsequently issued a statement on her blog reading, 'I just received word that the woman responsible has very close ties to PETA, despite PETA publicly stating otherwise.

'Not only has PETA lied to the public, but they have proved that they support this kind of behavior. I've been a vocal supporter of PETA for a long time but I have also been very vocal about anti-bullying, so this was a huge disappointment for me.'

Focused: The singer glared at those chanting at her amid the tense moments

Moving forward: The Girls Cruise star is one in a number of stars who have been confronted for her fashion choices, along with Jennifer Lopez, Chrissy Teigen and Kim Kardashian

Trademark: The singer has past donned fur ensembles, such as earlier this week in Atlanta

She wrapped in saying, 'Bullying and harassment is NEVER a solution, and I won't be a part of any organization that thinks otherwise.'

PETA also tangled with Kim's nascent husband Kanye West that year for his fur-wearing, as well as the lyric in his 2012 track Theraflu, 'Someone tell PETA my mink is dragging on the floor.'

In response, the organization told The Wall Street Journal, 'What’s dragging on the floor is Kanye’s reputation as a man with no empathy for animals or human beings.

'He’s a great musician but doesn’t seem to have the fashion sense to design anything more than caveman costumes.'
